thread.title: Senate Approves Defense Bill
thread.title_full: Senate Approves Defense Bill - The New York Times

author: The Associated Press
title: Senate Approves Defense Bill
text: Congress has sent President Obama a $612 billion defense policy bill that he has threatened to veto over an continuing partisan battle about government spending. The Senate vote on Wednesday was 70-27. If Mr. Obama vetoes the bill, it would be only the fifth time a president has vetoed a defense authorization bill in the past half-century. The House passed it last week, 269-151. There were enough Democratic votes to sustain a presidential veto. Mr. Obama said he would veto the bill because while it contains all the money he requested, it increase defense spending by padding a war-fighting account with an extra $38 billion.
